daily_summary.headline: Blue Origin's NS-38 Crewed Suborbital Flight Highlights the Day

top_events.title: Blue Origin New Shepard NS-38 Crewed Flight
top_events.description: Blue Origin launches its 17th crewed New Shepard mission, carrying six private individuals to the edge of space and back. This continues the commercial space tourism trend and provides rare suborbital flight access for civilians.
top_events.action: Watch the live stream and follow crew updates.

top_events.title: Rocket Lab Electron Launch: Open Cosmos Constellation 1
top_events.description: Rocket Lab launches the first two satellites for Open Cosmos' secure LEO broadband constellation, enhancing European connectivity infrastructure.
top_events.action: Tune in to the webcast for mission details.

top_events.title: Aurora G1 Storm Opportunity (Kp 4.67)
top_events.description: A minor geomagnetic storm may allow aurora sightings at far northern latitudes (above 65°) around midday UTC. Visibility is limited for most users.
top_events.action: Check northern sky if at high latitude; photography possible with clear, dark skies.

alerts.title: Blue Origin NS-38 Crewed Suborbital Flight
alerts.message: Blue Origin's New Shepard will carry six private individuals to space today. Watch the live stream for this rare civilian suborbital mission.
alerts.action_required: Watch live stream or follow updates.

opportunities.recommendation: Possible aurora at high latitudes. Best for northern locations (65°+). Worth checking if conditions are optimal.
